sen.j: 二階堂 行盛（にかいどう ゆきもり、1181年（養和元年） - 1253年12月30日（建長5年12月9日 (旧暦)））は、二階堂行政の孫で鎌倉幕府の政所執事、評定衆。
sen.e: Yukimori NIKAIDO (1181 - December 30, 1253) was a grandson of Yukimasa NIKAIDO and Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board) of the Kamakura bakufu and hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).

Yukimori NIKAIDO (1181 - December 30, 1253) was a grandson of Yukimasa NIKAIDO and Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board) of the Kamakura bakufu and hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).

Yukimori NIKAIDO (1181 - December 30, 1253) was a grandson of Yukimasa NIKAIDO and Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board) of the Kamakura bakufu and hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).

sen.j: 父二階堂行光のあと政所執事は行光の甥の伊賀光宗となったが、光宗が1224年（元仁元年）の伊賀氏の変で流罪となったあと行盛が就任する（『吾妻鏡』貞応3年（1224年）閏7月29日条）。
sen.e: Mitsumune IGA, a nephew of Yukimitsu NIKAIDO, became Mandokoro Shitsuji after his father Yukimitsu, and Yukimori became it after Koshu was exiled in the incident of the Iga clan in 1224 ("Azuma Kagami" article dated July 29, 1224).

Mitsumune IGA, a nephew of Yukimitsu NIKAIDO, became Mandokoro Shitsuji after his father Yukimitsu, and Yukimori assumed the post after Koshu was exiled in the incident of the Iga clan in 1224 ("Azuma Kagami" article dated July 29, 1224).

sen.j: 1225年（嘉禄元年）に出家し法名を行然と名乗るが、政務を退いた訳ではなく、1253年（建久5年）12月9日に72歳で没するまで政所執事として鎌倉幕府の要職にあった。
sen.e: He became a priest and had a homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name used in the Shin sect) of Gyonen in 1225, but did not quit government affairs and served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board), which was an important post in the Kamakura bakufu until he died at the age of 72 on December 9, 1253.

sen.j: 以降この家系がほぼ政所執事を世襲し、最初は二階堂行泰が継ぐが、その子の早死になどで行盛の他の子、行泰の弟の二階堂行綱、二階堂行忠の家に移り、1286年（弘安9年）に行忠からその孫の二階堂行貞に受け継がれた。
sen.e: This family line inherited Mandokoro Shitsuji subsequently, Yukiyasu NIKAIDO succeeded it first, but since his son died young, it was transferred to another child of Yukimori, a brother of Yukiyasu, Yukutsuna NIKAIDO, Yukitada NIKAIDO, and it was transferred from Yukitada to his grandson, Yukisada NIKAIDO in 1286.
